channel.title: Recent Programming Jobs
channel.description: Recent Jobs posted to the Programming category on We Work Remotely

item.title: DataStax: DSE Software Engineer in Test: (Performance)
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, CA
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax, the company that powers the online applications that transform business, is looking for a creative Software Engineer in Test.  We are seeking an inquisitive mind who can fearlessly undertake testing cutting edge technology by pushing it to its very limit. In this role, you'll master and test the internals of Apache Cassandra and/or DataStax Enterprise, as well as all clients that access these technologies.

The Process

The interview process will include a python coding test and other smaller assignments to gauge your linux skills and test planning thought process.

Essential Job Functions
The cool stuff you’ll do

  • Authoring, executing and automating test plans or tools for a product whose end user is a developer or devops engineer.
  • A heavy emphasis will be placed on server side, distributed test automation, with our primary language being Python.  
  • This role will require you to use Java debugging and profiling tools, code dive into the code base.  Since we are a high performance database all functional testing undergoes performance, scalability and availability testing as a core part of the test discipline.
  • Our test engineers write user facing blog posts / tutorials, as well as debug customer issues.

Job Requirements
The stuff you'll need to succeed

  • Strong aptitude for scripting, Linux administration, debugging in java and python environments
  • Knowledge of Python scripting a strong plus, but we offer this as an opportunity for a seasoned programmer to pick up a new skill
  • Understanding the complexities of testing in a distributed, big data environment, as well as testing a software platform that has an infinite input space
  • Strong scientific mindset, hypothesis, test, evaluate, repeat in order to gauge performance.
  • Passion for making great software in a small company setting
  • History of learning new technologies on the fly
  • Possessing assertive communication style
  • Experienced working in a distributed team and exchanging ideas via IRC and HipChat
  • Be a confident coder who is comfortable being code reviewed via github pull requests
  • Efficiency in working in an agile development process
  • Can be located anywhere in the U.S. but SF Bay Area preferred

To apply: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=o18m0fwf&s=gcusso

item.title: DataStax: DSE Timeseries Engineer
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, CA
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax is looking for a talented engineer with expertise building high-performance, distributed systems to join our team in creating a distributed, scalable NoSQL data management platform.  DataStax Enterprise Server, based on Apache Cassandra, allows you to easily run analytics and search on your real real time data.


Primary responsibilities include:
  • Participate in and drive general product development for our DataStax Timeseries product
  • Cutting edge work on Cassandra and related Timeseries technologies
  • Implement and resolve hard customer requests and issues

QualificationsThe stuff you'll need to succeed:
  • Strong Cassandra background
  • Strong Timeseries technologies
  • Strong Java background in systems or back-end software
  • Experience designing multithreaded systems
  • Comfortable working with a distributed, larger development organization
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Passionate about high performance large scale systems
  • Well organized and enjoys the freedom of working independently
  • BS degree in Computer Science

The stuff that would be nice to have (but not a deal breaker)
  • 5+ years software development experience
  • Experience with scalable systems design and implementation
  • Familiarity with SQL and relational databases
  • Experience with any of Solr, Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, Shark
  • Involvement in an open-source community
  • Experience with git source control
  • Familiarity with Scala

To apply: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=oqUj0fwn&s=gcusso

item.title: DataStax: Cassandra Internals Engineer
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, CA
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax is looking for a Cassandra Internals Engineer to help take Cassandra to the next level.  At DataStax you will work closely with Apache Cassandra project chair Jonathan Ellis and many committers both at DataStax and in the broader community from all over the world.  

Essential Job Functions:

  • Work with the community to design, implement and review features for Apache Cassandra, with a focus on those conferring performance advantages
  • Troubleshoot bug reports from internal QA, from customers, and the Apache community
  • Eventually achieve committer status on Apache Cassandra
  • Explain the Cassandra family of technologies to the world through blog posts and conference presentations
 

Job Requirements:

  • Strong Java background in systems or back-end software
  • Experience designing multi-threaded systems and algorithms
  • Knowledge of common data structures, algorithms and architectures, and the ability to apply this knowledge practically
  • Good written communication skills: comfortable with a distributed team interacting primarily over email, IRC, and our bug tracker
  • Comfortable reading, reviewing, and modifying others' code
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
 

Nice to have

  • Experience with scalable systems design and implementation
  • Comfortable reasoning about algorithmic complexity
  • Comfortable researching specialized data structures and algorithms
  • Involvement in an open-source community
  • BS degree in Computer Science or Equivalent

To apply: Apply Here: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=oSHm0fwF&s=gcusso

item.title: KickBack Rewards Systems: Senior Front-End Developer
item.description:
Location: Twin Falls, ID
URL: http://careers.kickbacksystems.com

KickBack is seeking a talented, motivated and most of all passionate front-end developer. Most of our frontend tools are very modern, built in the last year and written in AngularJS. That means you'll love your job because those that contributed before you care about quality and the craft of software development as much as you do and write elegant code and beautiful front-end applications.

Responsibilities
  • Write elegant front-end code applications with HTML/CSS and Javascript (AngularJS)
  • Implement new features and optimize existing ones from controller-level to UI
  • Improve tools and iterate on their user-experience so our products remain world-class.
  • Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from, user-experience developers, product management, interaction designers, and back-end engineers
  • Rapidly fix bugs and solve problems
  • Pro-actively look for ways to make KickBack better

Required Skills and Experience
  • Demonstrable experience building world-class, consumer web application interfaces
  • Expert in Javascript/HTML/CSS
  • Experience with AngularJS
  • Experience with RESTful backend api's servicing the frontend with JSON documents
  • Knowledgeable foundation in interaction design principles
  • Strong command of web standards, CSS-based design, cross-browser compatibility
  • Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
  • Good understanding of web technologies (HTTP, Apache) and familiarity with Unix/Linux
  • Great written communication and documentation abilities
  • You are passionate about the craft of writing software
  • Must be able to effectively communicate progress and ideas
  • Hacker mentality

About KickBack
KickBack Rewards Systems is on a mission to make good customers better. KickBack operates America's largest coalition loyalty program called “KickBack Points.” With our software solution and loyalty platform that integrates directly into a merchants point-of-sale system a customer can earn points, valuable rewards and then spend their KickBack points like cash at convenience stores, grocers and major drug chains across the country. If you are looking for a mature and profitable organization that maintains an innovative atmosphere with a stable management team who likes to work hard and work smart we are likely a good fit.

To apply: Apply at http://careers.kickbacksystems.com/ select "Front End Engineer" and Click "Apply" or be a rebel and send a resumé to brian@kickbackpoints.com.

item.title: Hello Labs | BeQuick: Lead Developer, Ruby
item.description:
Location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL
URL: http://www.bequick.com

Hello Labs is hiring an experienced developer to help us build and launch new software for the mobile telecommunications industry. We look for staff who want to work together to build valuable, high-quality products for our customers.  We encourage learning and are always open to new ideas - especially if they lead to us delivering better software.

What we use:

  • Our technology stack currently includes Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, Ember JS, and AWS (CloudFormation, EC2, S3, CloudFront, DynamoDB, etc.)
  • We use Github, Hipchat, Sococo, Splunk, and Atlassian and Google products to stay organized and in touch

Who we want:

  • You communicate well - in your code and in correspondence with non-technical people
  • You are approachable and humble
  • You love learning and teaching, and are able to give and receive constructive criticism
  • You enjoy being involved in high-level design and planning
  • You strive to be an expert with your toolset

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Great family benefits (Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k) matching)
  • An agile development environment
  • A small team who meets virtually for daily standups and works from stories in a 2-week sprint cycle
  • Paid trips to Florida to hang out and work with us
  • Paid trips to developer conferences
  • We cover tools for learning, like books and classes
  • Flexibility for time off to do personal things

Want to apply? Great. We’d love for you to include these things:

  • Your projects or favorite contributions on Github or Stack Overflow
  • What you’re currently interested in learning or wish you had time to learn
  • A link to your resume

To apply: Apply here: https://boards.greenhouse.io/hellolabs/jobs/44484#app

item.title: Hosted Desktop UK: Developer
item.description:
Location: Exeter, Devon, UK
URL: https://www.hosteddesktopuk.co.uk

We're looking for a talented and passionate Developer to join a successful and rapidly growing Cloud Services company based in Exeter, Devon, UK. You will be the first full time dev at Hosted Desktop UK and so a great time to lay down your mark.

Skills & experience required:
  • HTML / php / HTML5
  • MySQL / MSSQL
  • Github
  • VBScript / Powershell scripting
  • Windows & Linux systems experience
  • Wordpress experience advantageous
  • C++/C# experience desirable

What you'd be making:
You will be tasked with creating new and improving existing systems. From creating new php/html5 websites to creating vbscipts/powershell scripts to query Windows servers and MySQL/MSSQL databases. From creating visualizations tracking our users locations to creating database queries full of stats.

About you:
You might live in the UK and that's great. But we work remotely, so as long as your timezone crosses GMT by a minimum of 4 hours thats all we ask. We want to know that you've done this kind of work before. Whether you're coming from a big tech company or a small agency, your CV and pedigree don't matter nearly as much as the real world work you've put out in the world.

Ready to apply?
At HDUK we like to be different. We like to see extra effort in your application. Whether that's a script you wrote that you are really proud of or a custom website-that's up to you. We want to know if you're qualified, a good fit, and most importantly, you want this job and not just any job,

When you're ready, send an email to us at: jobs@hosteddesktopuk.co.uk. We will share everyone's application with the team and once narrowed down, come back to you.

If this sounds like you, I’m encouraging you to apply. If this isn’t you and sounds like someone you know, please pass the word along for us!

-------------------------------------

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

To apply: Please email: jobs@hosteddesktopuk.co.uk saying you want to be the HDUK lead Dev!

item.title: Clevertech: Spectacular Hebrew-speaking JS Front/Back-end Developer
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: www.clevertech.biz

About You

You are in love with Web Development (even though your friends don’t approve);

You are comfortable with javascript at all possible levels and love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You are proficient in both English and Hebrew (client is working on AlephBeta.org)

You’ve been developing web apps for at least three years;

You love new challenges and coming up with ways to solving them;

You understand the advantages of working remotely, and have a good internet connection and some quiet space to video chat or share your screen to do some pair programming;

You are ok with working at least 4-5 hours in EST time.

About Clevertech

We at Clevertech help companies (mostly startups) hatch and grow to reach their ambition.

We’ve been doing that for over 13 years and have over 35 developers, scattered all over the world working together.

Our clients have been featured in the NY Times, Forbes, TechCrunch and Mashable. You can see (our CEO) Kuty Shalev’s presentation at Lean Startup Conference http://goo.gl/MsTcp or go to our websitehttp://www.clevertech.biz to learn a bit more about us.

We have a ton of work from amazing companies who are starting up and testing the market with their ideas, and we help them find out if its worth pushing ahead or try to find something else.

Some of our clients have raised money and have been featured in the press. Others have successful, established businesses. Some discover that its worth trying something else.

We use the latest technologies — our focus in is full-stack JavaScript. Node.js + AngularJS + PostgreSQL/MySQL (+ MongoDB + Redis + Solr/Lucene as needed).

We also love to contribute to Open Source. Check out our GitHub @ https://github.com/clevertech

About the Job

If you think we fit each other, reach out with some recent work and tell us a story about your ambition and how working with us will help you achieve it.

This is a full-time, fully remote, 8h/day, 40h/week, 160h/month offer.

Note for US residents: this is corp-2-corp (1099, not W2).

To apply: http://hire.clevertech.biz/job/54c14237b7bd4591121d83de

item.title: Bitovi: JavaScript Developer / Consultant
item.description:
Location: Chicago, IL (Remote Position)
URL: www.bitovi.com

We’re looking for passionate JavaScript developers who identify with our mission.

We want someone who enjoys identifying the hard parts of application development and simplifying them, talking about software architecture, and teaching others. We also want someone who can lead others and be an integral part of a team, but can also vibe with the dev team after the workday.  Specifically, the following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:

  • Some experience contributing to (or at least using) open source projects
  • Doesn’t mind a bit of travel, averaging one week every other month, possibly more
  • Has strong opinions about the right way to develop
  • Has a lot of JavaScript experience
  • Has some experience with back-end systems and databases

We’re a team of 25ish developers and designers located around the US, Canada, Europe, and South America. This is a remote position, but due to travel requirements, we have a strong preference for US-based developers right now.

 
The Job

As soon as you begin, we’ll train you to become an expert in JavaScript application design, front-end architecture, and our JavaScriptMVC stack of tools. You’ll work with clients creating applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies.

In addition to client work, you’ll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the JavaScript community in your own way. Bitovi developers:

  • Present at conferences
  • Give trainings
  • Plan and run meetups
  • Create and maintain open source projects
  • Write articles

Benefits

Bitovians get a slate of great benefits. Bitovi offers:

  • Competitive salary and yearly bonuses
  • Bi-annual company retreats to places like Las Vegas, New Orleans, and Amelia Island, Florida
  • 401(k) plan with matching
  • 4 weeks of paid vacation
  • Health and dental insurance
  • Gym membership reimbursement
  • Maternity & paternity leave
  • Working from home with flexible hours

To apply: Write a resume and a thoughtful cover letter that shows us that you’re the kind of person we’ve described above, and send it to jobs@bitovi.com.

item.title: Clevertech: Astonishing PHP/MySQL CTO
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: www.clevertech.biz

About You

Web Development is your bread and butter. There’s no way you can start the day without a healthy dose of it.

You’re a PHP/MySQL veteran despite loving to try out new languages, frameworks and libraries. You know the ins and outs of it and could host a trivia show on it without any cue cards.

You’ve worked at a CTO or similar level and are ready to hit the ground running as a key team contributor.

You enjoy working remotely and know how to do so while on a team.

You have accomplishments and looking to keep adding new ones, quickly.

About Clevertech

We have been around for 14 years and have over 60 developers and designers, scattered all over the world working together.

We are very much enthralled by Agile and Lean principles, successfully launching products in short windows of time. That’s possible due to the power of focus.

Some of the great things we do are visible in http://cleverstack.io, http://cleverte.ch/bloomberg, http://visualcaptcha.net, and http://clevertech.biz.

We could tell you more, but it’s much more interesting to see what you find out.

About the Job

If you fit this description, reach out with your 2-3 best accomplishments and tell us a story about your ambition and how working with us will help you achieve it.

We only require that you work at least 5 hours within New York’s 9am-5pm.

This is a full-time, fully remote, 8h/day, 40h/week, 160h/month offer.

Note for US residents: this is corp-2-corp (1099, not W2).

To apply: http://hire.clevertech.biz/job/54c14114b7bd4591121d83d7

item.title: Gear Stream, Inc.: JavaScript / Java Developer for Encuestame Customization
item.description:
Location: Raleigh
URL: www.gearstream.com

We are exploring the use of Encuestame (an opensource social survey project) as a codebase we would form into a private software project that would support our Web and Mobile survey requirements.  To be helpful to us you MUST be familiar with and have previously done customizations and implementation of Survey solutions in the social / web / mobile context using JavaScript, Java, CSS and specifically the Encuestame code base.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

item.title: Elegant Themes: WordPress Theme Developer
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.elegantthemes.com

About Our Company

ElegantThemes.com is a leader in WordPress Theme Development. We have been building the top premium WordPress themes for the past 5 years, and we have one of the largest customer bases in the market. 222,719 customers depend on our beautiful designs, and we work hard every day to make sure we are creating the best themes around. We have a distributed team of 33, with a small central office in San Francisco.

We work in a beautiful, light-filled room in the heart of SOMA in San Francisco. Our office is packed with the best equipment you could hope for, and filled with a fun-loving atmosphere. If you happen to live in San Francisco, working with our small team is a lot of fun. If you prefer to work remotely, that's fine too. Our whole team lives on HipChat and we develop as a group on Github.

About The Job

  • The Basics: This is a full time position available to both remote and on-site employees. Employment includes full benefits, paid vacation, a competitive salary and unlimited espresso brewed from our Rocket Cellini Premium Plus v2.
  • Duties Of The Job: Our developers work on creating new themes and maintaining old ones. This includes taking PSD files and building them into complete, functional, responsive themes built on top of our own framework. Our developers are also tasked with fixing bugs and addressing whatever issues our customers bring to our attention.
  • Who We Are Looking For: This position is for someone with a deep understanding of WordPress. You have built your own themes and plugins before, and possibly even contributed to WordPress Core. You enjoy finding elegant solutions to complex problems, and are familiar with the WordPress motto - "code is poetry." You are up-to-date with the latest and greatest trends and technologies because you are engaged in the open source community, and you enjoy building software that pushes the web forward.

Required Experience

  • Complete understanding of the WordPress core software and its functions at the code level
  • Experiencing building WordPress themes/plugins
  • Understanding of WordPress coding best practices
  • WordPress/Programming security best practices
  • Ability to be creative and contribute based on your own merit
  • Ability to function within a small team and startup atmosphere

Required Skills

  • PHP
  • CSS
  • HTML
  • MYSQL
  • JQUERY

Bonus Qualifications

  • Github Experience
  • SVN Experience
  • A history of open source software contribution

To apply: http://elegantthemes.theresumator.com/apply/2KlOeO/WordPress-Theme-Developer.html

item.title: Fractured Atlas: Help Build a More Creative, Beautiful World
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: http://www.fracturedatlas.org

Fractured Atlas helps artists succeed as entrepreneurs. We build software that helps artists raise money, find space to perform, insure their work, ticket their shows, and connect with their patrons to build lasting relationships.

ABOUT YOU

You’ve been working on Ruby on Rails for several years. You have experience working on  production applications and can talk about what went wrong and what went right with your current project. Ruby is great, for sure, but you’re into lots of other technologies too.

ABOUT US

Fractured Atlas is a non-profit tech company. Our goal is to change the world by fostering creativity, not to maximize profits for some VC investor.

When working with us, you’ll be changing the world through code.

We fulfill our mission through technology products used by our members. Artful.ly manages ticketing, donations, and patrons for some of the most innovative performing arts organizations in New York and across the country. SpaceFinder creates online marketplaces for renting rehearsal, performance, and studio spaces. Our fiscal sponsorship program helps raise tens of millions of dollars each year so independent artists can create new work. Our insurance program has helped over 10,000 artists and organizations get quality coverage at amazing rates.

We build these tools using a blend of Ruby on Rails, jQuery, Haml, Sass, Solr, MySQL, Postgres, and Twitter Bootstrap. We're always diving into new technology to see how it can help make our applications better. If you have some tech that you're really excited about then we'll find a way to use it and improve the product.

Our products are young but very successful so far. We want to add a talented and passionate developer (like you!) to help us grow these products from early success to long-term prosperity.

WE’LL GET ALONG GREAT IF YOU HAVE...

  1. Enthusiasm
  2. Attention to Detail
  3. Proficiency in Ruby and Rails
  4. A connection to the arts
NOT REQUIRED, BUT EXTRA EXCITING WOULD BE…

  1. Experience with Heroku and Amazon AWS/EC2/RDS
  2. Made contributions to open source products
  3. Interest or experience in UI/UX engineering

REMOTE

You can live anywhere you want (as long as it’s in a US time zone and you’ve got solid English language skills). Fractured Atlas’s headquarters is in midtown Manhattan, so if you happen to be NYC-based and want to work from here, we’ll happily make room for you. The majority of our software development team is remote, though, so we need the kind of developer who thrives in that setup

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Starting salary is $90,000
  • Health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Budget to buy or build your own hardware
  • Paid vacation, personal, and sick days
  • TransitChek if you’re in NYC
  • Professional development budget to use to buy software or take classes in anything
  • Fun office with fun people, a Wii Lounge, Waffle Wednesdays, and lots of assorted other goodies
  • An alternative to typical startup culture; you’ll work hard here, but you’re also expected to have a life outside work

To apply: Please email: a substantive cover letter, code samples or links, and a résumé to Tim Cynova, Deputy Director at jobs@fracturedatlas.org. Include “Software Engineer” as the email’s subject line.

item.title: DataStax: Software Engineer - Java Driver
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, CA
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax, the company that powers the online applications that transform business, is looking for a talented engineer to build, improve and evangelize world class drivers and tools for Cassandra and the DataStax Enterprise platform.

Essential Job Functions
The cool stuff you’ll do

  • Create and update high productivity tools that developers working with Cassandra will use daily
  • Troubleshoot bug reports from internal QA, from customers, and from the Apache community
  • Make developers more familiar with our tools through blog posts or meeting them in community events
 

Job Requirements
The stuff you’ll need to succeed

  • 5+ years of experience in back-end development role
  • Strong Java background in systems or back-end software
  • Familiar with popular tools and frameworks used in the enterprise Java space
  • Comfortable working with a team either locally or distributed
  • ​Familiarity with Scala​
  • BS degree in Computer Science
  • Candidates can be located anywhere; SF Bay Area is a plus
 

The stuff that would be nice to have (but not a deal breaker)

  • Familiarity with other languages such as ​​C#, Ruby,​ or PHP
  • Experience designing multi-threaded systems
  • Experience with Apache Cassandra or Hadoop
  • Experience with git source control

To apply: Apply Here: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=oZVl0fwZ&s=gcusso

item.title: Basecamp: Lead Android at Basecamp!
item.description:
Location: Chicago, IL
URL: https://basecamp.com

Hey there! We are Basecamp, the team behind the world’s #1 project management app. Last year alone, Basecamp helped over 350,000 companies work on more than 4,000,000 projects on web, iOS, and Android.

We’re looking for a programmer to lead us on Android and push us further into the platform. This is a unique opportunity: we don't hire often! We’ve got a serious foothold in the ecosystem, and we want you to take us to the next level.

Here’s a little preview of Basecamp for Android right now: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fG9AgQjbYIE

We’re happy to welcome applicants based anywhere around the world. Our office is based in Chicago, but our team is spread out over multiple countries and time zones. You can work from anywhere! We’re so serious about working remotely that we even wrote a book about it.

Basecamp offers benefits for the long run, including: 4 day work weeks during the summer, an exercise and CSA stipend, a 1 month sabbatical every 3 years, maternity and paternity leave, and health insurance that covers children, marriages, and domestic partnerships.

Who are we looking for?

We’re looking for someone who lives and breathes mobile, and especially on the Android platform. Fluency in Android’s patterns and APIs is a must. (Half-hearted iOS ports drive us crazy too!) We would love to talk to a developer who has experience shipping applications with a team, or independently on your own projects.

Here are some examples of day to day interactions with our mobile team: One day we might be diving through the Material design spec, and the next day we’ll be tossing around ideas for an Android Wear prototype.

What will you work on?

You’ll work on our mobile team to support and improve Basecamp for Android, side by side with our other programmers, designers, and QA team that enable our customers to get their work done better on the run.

Here are some fun stats from our app’s usage in the wild. Android is our fastest growing mobile application right now. Like many others with Android apps, we see a lot of older versions of Android, but we’re not afraid to welcome those users in while experimenting with the latest goodies from Google.

You’ll join the our team of programmers who work on our Rails and iOS apps. Basecamp is the home of Ruby on Rails, and we’ll be happy to introduce you to our infrastructure. Part of being a programmer at Basecamp is our on-call rotation, where we help fix day-to-day issues for our customers using our products.

We also believe strongly in putting everyone on support, which usually happens around once a month. If you have some experience with Rails, that’s a bonus—but not a requirement.

Have any more information?

Our full job posting at https://basecamp.com/jobs/android has more info about this post (including some in-progress work and data about our Android internals so far!), so please check that out too!

Also: We love cover letters. They're a great way to introduce yourself, but don't be afraid to surprise us in other creative ways too. We want to see what you've built and shipped, so any existing applications on the Google Play Store that we could try out would be great to include.

To apply: Please email android@basecamp.com saying that you want to lead the Android charge at Basecamp, and we'll be in touch!

item.title: Core-apps: PHP Developer with Personality
item.description:
Location: Arnold, MD
URL: http://www.core-apps.com/

Core-apps is the leading app developer in the event industry space, and we are looking for a PHP developer who is looking to join a fun team to gain practical experience and knowledge all while working at home in your PJs. You'll be working with fellow geeks on a variety of tasks including maintaining our existing code base, adding new features, tracking down pesky bugs, and growing and thriving in a high-energy team environment. We are looking for developers who have the following:

  • 2-5 yrs of professional experience using PHP
  • OOP experience
  • JavaScript experience, including jQuery
  • Integrations with SOAP and REST
  • Working knowledge of Linux
  • Great communication skills
  • Relational database design (e.g. with MySQL)
  • Enjoys the challenges of navigating and learning large code bases
  • Pluses, but not necessary: MVC frameworks like Angular, Ember; Java, C++, Ruby; Linux server administration experience

This is a full-time, salaried position with benefits. We are NOT looking for contractors or development firms, and are not looking to work through a recruiter. Solicitations will not be tolerated.

About Core-apps

We began as a startup over five years ago, and have grown leaps and bounds since then (including acquiring another company) to the point where we now dominate our niche market. We produce event apps for conventions and tradeshows of all sizes, including some of the biggest and best names in just about every industry of which one could think.

Our development team is distributed across the US and Canada, so you can work wherever you please so long as you have a fast and stable internet connection and a place where you can work without interruptions.

To apply: Send your resume and a cover letter/message to geekjobs+php@core-apps.com. Remember, we are wanting to find someone who fits in well, so give us a taste of your personality in your cover letter!

item.title: SkyVerge: WordPress Engineer
item.description:
Location: Planet Earth
URL: http://www.skyverge.com

Do you look for creative ways to use the Heartbeat API? Maybe you’re just waiting for the perfect moment to use `wp_list_pluck()`? You’re in good company! SkyVerge is looking for a full-time WordPress engineer to join us as the 9th member of our fully distributed team. You’ll be responsible for contributing to projects that currently power over a quarter-million WooCommerce stores, building new products, and making sure that we ones we already offer stay golden.

Our WordPress engineer will be...

  • Building new plugins from a collaborative spec (exercise your architectural skills!)
  • Adding new features to existing plugins
  • Maintaining existing plugin compatibility, including bug fixes
  • Adhering to both WordPress and internal code standards and frameworks
  • Providing top-tier customer support and service
  • Comfortable working remotely with availability for 1-2 team trips per year

This position will primarily involve development for WooCommerce, which is the largest eCommerce platform, powering over 400,000 online stores. While familiarity with WooCommerce is a huge plus, experience with WordPress and extensive knowledge of its architecture (actions/filters, WPDB, WP_Query, etc) is a hard requirement - we know you’ll love learning WooCommerce from the ground-up, or will be excited to level up your existing knowledge as needed.

Our WooCommerce plugins usually involve our entire development team with one engineer as project lead. You’ll be involved in reviewing, maintaining, and building plugins from collaborative spec.

If you’re our ideal team member, you take pride in committing object-oriented, PHP 5.2-compatible code to GitHub. You love solving engineering challenges in the simplest way possible with code that’s clear, readable, and standards-compliant. More importantly, you appreciate how beautiful a solution is when any customer can use it, and you love getting feedback from and interacting with customers to improve products. You’re excited to work with a small team that loves their work as much as you do, and affords the opportunity to work on interesting projects, learn and improve upon several skill sets, and to constantly ship cool projects. Oh, and you know it’s capital_P_dangit().

Our WooCommerce plugins require you to be fluent in PHP and MySQL, and knowledge of the WordPress architecture is key. Javascript, HTML, and CSS are also part of each plugin that we ship, and will be part of your arsenal. Knowledge of Sass and CoffeeScript is helpful, too.

We have other projects that use Ruby and other languages, so familiarity with these is a plus. If not, are you excited to learn about them? That’s great, too - it’s important to us that you want to learn new stacks, as what we all know now will be outdated soon anyway. We plan on being around for a lot longer, and growth is imperative to that goal.

Our team stays in touch primarily via Slack and weekly stand-ups over Google Hangout -- availability for 1-2 team trips per year is necessary.

This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible (4 hrs overlap with EST) - we know your work will speak for itself with commits, issues closed, and wiki edits. However, fit with our team and culture is important -- following an interview, we’ll ask for a quick sample project for which you’ll be paid as a contractor. If we both think the project went well, our employees go through a 60-day ‘bootcamp’ as a 1099-employee before being “made” as a salaried employee. This lets us both make sure that we’re an ideal match, otherwise we can each say, “No thanks,” and move on to different projects.

Here are some benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary with additional performance incentives for meeting team and company goals
  • Paid vacation time to make sure you get to unplug (3 weeks per year)
  • Health and dental insurance for US residents, their spouses or domestic partners, and children
  • Retirement plan with company match
  • Reimbursement for hardware/software you'll need as part of your job (everyone needs a retina MacBook Pro and Thunderbolt display)
  • Reimbursement for professional growth experiences, like conferences or books. The desire to learn and improve is key to our business and we need team members who as as excited about it as we are.

TL, DR: Join our team to build cool stuff with WordPress and influence a quarter-million online stores. Excited? Us too :) Apply below.

To apply: Punch in your details over at http://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/33157/candidates/new

item.title: ActiveCampaign: Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Location: Chicago, IL
URL: http://www.activecampaign.com

ActiveCampaign is a marketing platform focused on email marketing & marketing automation for small businesses. 

We have helped over 100,000 businesses grow while managing billions of interactions & messages. Building a company & platform that we believe in (and that we are proud of) is at our core.

We are looking for a talented full stack developer to join us as we extend our marketing platform and work to scale with our growing client base.

While we have an office in Chicago, we are looking for the best fit whether you are near Chicago or a thousand miles away. We have people in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, & Australia. Decent time overlap with the CST timezone is preferred.

Some things your day could consist of:

  • Brainstorming with a dynamic team to flesh out new ideas or investigate tricky bugs.
  • Optimizing existing functionality for improved response times.
  • Prototyping code with your first draft, then polishing later, in a dedicated developer environment.
  • Debugging and resolving platform issues reported by our users.
  • Letting creative ideas rule the day; don't settle for the first solution, search for the right one.
  • Roll out a new feature and analyze (and react) to the results you discover from our system services and user feedback.

What is needed:

  • Excellent communication skills. We communicate constantly via messaging & video about ideas, issues, and to help each other out.
  • A desire to be part of a small team where hierarchy is not encouraged, everyone's input matters, your work has a high impact, and everyone is working together.
  • Extensive & proven experience with PHP, MySQL, & jQuery. Other languages and systems are a plus.
  • Passionate about optimization and scaling to accommodate a growing number of end users. The feeling of finding a better way to do something is priceless.
  • Care about the user experience. Everyone is always thinking about the user and ways we can improve the workflow. We have some great UI/UX designers who can assist you.
  • Being able to take a general idea and add your own insight and tweaks to it.

Benefits:

  • Join an agile & growing team (of 14) focused on innovating small business marketing
  • 401k with dollar to dollar matching
  • Free medical/dental insurance
  • Free transportation
  • Flexible paid vacation & holidays
  • Casual work atmosphere
  • Choose your work setup
  • Chicago location that you can work from. Or work remote like many of us do.

To apply: Email employment@activecampaign.com with a brief history of your development experience, resume, and some code examples.

item.title: DocuSign: Senior UI Engineer
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.docusign.com

DocuSign is looking for an experienced UI Engineer to join our dynamic team in our San Francisco office. The person for this role will have a passion for transforming the complicated into clean, effortless UIs. In this role, you will create and maintain reusable UI components to be integrated into our web applications. You will also work closely with design and engineering to prototype to continually improve and grow the library of components.
 
Responsibilities
 
·        Build and polish modular, scalable, responsive HTML/CSS; bring designs to life with code that’s DRY, understandable, and easy to maintain
·        Prototype experimental features for usability testing and futurevisioning
·        Build and maintain our living style guide
·        Build complex user interactions and evaluate tools and plugins; be totally comfortable writing your own CSS and JS
·        Work closely with designers to help produce ideas and prototype early concepts, while also collaborating with product managers, engineers and other disciplines to help build out great user experiences
·        Build functional, cross-browser and responsive applications while thinking about performance of your code and finished product
·        Manage a small set of environments and development branches
·        Proactively look for ways to make DocuSign better
 
Requirements
 
·        5 years of professional experience developing modular, responsive web application user interfaces
·        Advanced, hands-on coding in CSS3/HTML5
·        Detailed experience with CSS layout including responsive design techniques
·        Solid working knowledge of JavaScript
·        Unfazed by cross-browser madness, and experience supporting older browsers while simultaneously building features for modern browsers
·        Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, headers, caching, etc.)
·        Experienced liaising between Designers and Front-end Engineers (feature developers)
·        Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
·        An eye for detail and a passion for perfection
·        Familiar with JS frameworks such as Angular, Backbone, etc.
·        Familiarity with modern CSS frameworks, tools and workflow and can speak to their pros/cons
·        Familiarity with Git a plus
·        Bachelor Degree, preferred
·        Link to your Github or other repository of your best work
·        Willing & able to work out of DocuSign's San Francisco, CA offices OR live within 3 hours of PST and have extensive experience working remotely, directly for a company providing large-scale web services, and be willing to travel to SF at least 3-4 times annually
 
You must CURRENTLY possess the legal right to work in the USA (TN Visa eligible is okay)
**Principals ONLY, no agency/consulting submittals.
 
About DocuSign
Trusted. Innovative. Elegant. Engaging. Liberating. Ubiquitous. We're DocuSign. With 27 million users who have DocuSigned more than 200 million documents in 188 countries, our technology is the global standard for signing everything, everywhere. We are a customer-focused, innovative, fast-moving industry leader whose technology has reached mainstream. Every consumer,
individual professional, work group, and company is a potential customer. With 60,000 new users joining the DocuSign Global Network every business day, we're in the midst of incredible hyper growth.

To apply: SFProdDevHiring@docusign.com You must CURRENTLY possess the legal right to work in the USA (TN Visa eligible is okay) **Principals ONLY, no agency/consulting submittals.

item.title: 112 Tech: Team Webmaster
item.description:
Location: Your location

We are looking for a motivated webmaster who enjoys the benefits of working from home. We are an experienced, driven and tightly-knit company with a team spread across many countries.
This position is for a webmaster who will be a key part of the team responsible for working to build, expand and improve the company's network of websites.

Job duties for this position include:
  • Editing current websites utilizing html, php, css
  • Creating new websites by working with design, writing and markup teams to combine elements
  • Updating content in html as well as custom cms
  • Recognizing opportunities for improvement of current websites including SEO, code improvements, content improvements and other general updates
  • Working closely with designers, coders and writers to update websites and help organize the creation of new websites
  • Brainstorming for new, unique ideas to improve our sites or expand our network

The person in this position should be self-motivated, well-organized, a team player, and detail-oriented. Must be willing to give and accept positive criticism and be willing to try new ideas, learn new skills and experiment with different ways of accomplishing tasks. The ability to work independently is also very important as the person in this position will be working from their home office. They must be able to take on a task and see it through, often without immediate input from other team members. With this in mind, time management is also an important skill. There will often be multiple tasks ongoing at the same time and it will be up to each team member to complete their jobs on time as to keep the work flowing.

Skills required include:
  • General html, css, php, wordpress knowledge
  • Some understanding of CMS/databases
  • Experience using FTP
  • Some knowledge of basic website design
  • Image editing

We would like to know about your previous working experience and more particularly any office based work that you may have had, if you have had any, please detail.
Please also only apply if you are based in US or European timezones.

Proposed salary: £26,000-30,000
                         €33,300-38,400
                         $39,400-45,400

To apply: Please follow this link to upload your CV: http://112tech.theresumator.com/apply/rjD566/Team-Webmaster.html

item.title: Launch Academy: Educational Content Engineer
item.description:
Location: Boston, MA
URL: http://www.launchacademy.com

Launch Academy is a Boston-based developer education company that is pioneering new ways for people to learn the craft of web development. We believe that everyone who wants to learn to code, can do so  and we are their guide througout the full learn to code lifecycle. Our on-site bootcamp experience has produced over 200 talented developers over the last 2+ years and we’re now taking our unique collaborative learning methodologies online so that we can reach more people. Our goal is to teach 10,000 aspiring developers in 2015 through a combination of our bootcamp experience and our online content and community.

To apply: Apply directly at http://launchacademy.theresumator.com/apply/Gql3nt/Digital-Content-Creator.html

item.title: Continu: Software Engineer (Javascript)
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: https://continu.co

We’re looking for a talented and passionate Software Engineer to join the Continu team Full-Time.

About Continu
At Continu, our mission is to solve workplace problems with simple, intuitive solutions that empower our users. Continu is a Talent Management platform that helps unlock organizational performance through streamlined Recruitment, On-boarding, Learning and Analytics. It’s People Operations, simplified.

We’re looking for someone who has experience with:
  • Javascript (strong experience required)
  • Angular.js 
  • Building on the MEAN stack (MongoDB/Mongoose, Angular, Node, Express)
  • HTML5 & CSS3
  • CSS preprocessors (SASS and LESS)
  • Github
  • Responsive Web
  • Photoshop

Bonus Points if you have experience with:
  • Start-ups
  • Open-source projects
  • Working in a distributed team environment

As a Software Engineer at Continu, you will:
  • Be responsible for all things Angular.js
  • Work between our web app and API(s)
  • Be a pixel perfectionist, striving to build out beautiful and highly functional user interfaces
  • Work closely with all team members in a highly collaborative, distributed work environment 
  • Have excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Focus on delighting our customers
  • Be passionate about the problems we are solving 
  • Be comfortable speaking directly to clients if needed
  • Be active in the development community and give back as much as possible

Where you’ll work:
Wherever you feel most creative – from home, a coffee shop or a co-working space. We’re a completely distributed team with employees located across the US and Australia.

To apply: To apply, please send a copy of your resume, along with a link to your Github account to: work@continu.co

item.title: RadiantIQ: Senior Engineer
item.description:
Location: Boulder, CO
URL: http://www.radiantiq.com

RadiantIQ is building a next generation communications platform for voice, messaging and mobility services and we need your help! If you're looking for a fun, fast-paced environment where your decisions have a real impact on our company's continued success then we want to hear from you!

Our entire solution stack is built from scratch using some of the latest technologies such as Java 1.8, MongoDB, HazelCast and Angular. Our system processes volumes of data in real time supporting millions of end user clients with services such as voice, SMS/MMS, and mobility.

We have an immediate need for software engineers. We're generally interested in the usual: BS or MS in computer science, a few years years experience, etc. However, if you think you have the chops to take on development of a brand new communications platform and you're lacking in one or more of those formal requirements, we still want to hear from you!

In general, you are someone smart that gets stuff done. In particular, you would benefit from experience with some or more of the following:

- Extensive Java experience
- MongoDB
- Spring and Spring MVC (Grails experience a plus)
- Telecom including (but not limited to) SMPP, SIP, etc.
- Unit testing
- Continuous integration and deployment
- Using tools such as coverage analysis, stylistic analysis and complexity analysis to help inform code quality
- Building large and highly transactional systems
- Creating custom solutions to monitor system performance and help troubleshoot issues that come up during normal operation
- Deploying and monitoring Java web applications
- Container technologies like Docker
- Building and consuming an API
- Building and maintaining a UI (currently AngularJS)

If this is you, please hit us up! We offer generous compensation, health / vision / dental insurance, company equity, unlimited vacation time and an amazing team of folks ready to take our company to the next level.

For more information including a summary of our benefits, visit: http://bit.ly/WorkingAtRadiant

To apply: To apply, email jobs@radiantiq.com and include a link to your GitHub account and/or an example of something awesome you've built (please DO NOT INCLUDE proprietary code owned by your current or former employers).

item.title: Memberful: Enthusiastic and industrious Rails programmer (part-time)
item.description:
Location: United States
URL: https://memberful.com

Hi there! I’m Drew.

I want to introduce you to Memberful. Memberful is a 1 year old software service that makes it easy to set up membership sites and recurring billing with Stripe. Our 100+ customers are processing over $100,000 per month in transaction volume through our service. They use Memberful for: paid email newsletters, online communities and clubs, access to paid website content, podcast network donations, fitness training, and even co-working spaces. Our customers love the service, our churn is low, and our revenues have grown steadily during our first year in business.

We’re bootstrapped, and we’re still at least six months away from hiring a full-time programmer. I’m looking for someone to help us this year while we continue to grow up. This could very well turn into a full time position down the road, and I’d prefer someone who’s looking for that kind of project and commitment.

You’ll work directly with me. I handle the front end development and most of the customer service. I love working with people who are enthusiastic and industrious. I love working with people who get stuff done and embrace responsibility. I don’t like working with people who make excuses and can’t meet a deadline.

I’m looking for someone who loves to work because it’s fun to work. I’m looking for someone who is hungry and excited to work on a production application with modern tools and real paying customers. I’m not looking for someone who wants to just punch the clock, get by, and get paid.

What you'll work on

Our Rails application is already built, running, and reliable. This is fantastic. But, we still need to fix bugs and make lots of small refinements and improvements as we focus on our customers over the next year. You’ll be expected to:

  • Fix routine bugs that come up from time to time and respond to relevant customers in a timely manner.
  • Plan and ship incremental improvements to the service with me.
  • Be available in an emergency.

Some of the tools and services we use include: Basecamp, Github, HipChat, Intercom, Heroku, Stripe, Mixpanel, Librato, Circle CI, Mandrill, Papertrail.

Skills

You should have solid programming skills and preferably some experience with production Rails applications.

Time and payment

This is a part-time position — roughly 10 hours per week at a fixed retainer of $2,000 USD per month (paid by 1099 if you’re in the USA).

To apply: If you think you’d be a good fit, and would be excited to work with me on this project, send an email to jobs@memberful.com and tell me why.

item.title: FetLife (BitLove Inc.): Senior DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Location: Vancouver, Canada
URL: https://fetlife.com

At FetLife we are looking for a open-minded kink-friendly “Senior DevOps Engineer” to join FetLife’s Backend Team(tm).

You should have experience

  • Developing well tested and documented APIs
  • Writing performant and maintainable services in Ruby and/or Erlang
  • Working on and groking large codebases
  • Building and securing the infrastructure of a highly trafficked site
  • Managing infrastructure using tools like Chef

Bonus if you have experience

  • Working in an API Driven Development environment
  • Tuning services such as MySQL, memcached, Redis, and nginx
  • Tuning Erlang and Ruby

At FetLife you will be responsible for

  • Writing well tested and documented APIs
  • Developing, deploying, and maintaining services
  • Measuring and improving the performance of our APIs and services
  • Helping to manage FetLife’s infrastructure

At FetLife we 

  • Are 100% remote
  • Use GitHub, Waffle, Slack, and ScreenHero to collaborate

Why work at FetLife

  • Get a shiny new MacBook Pro and Cinema Display (no Watch… yet)
  • $5,000/year towards a health insurance plan of your choice
  • $140K+ USD/CAD salary
  • Have your work impact millions of people

More about FetLife

  • Largest kinky social network in the galaxy
  • We have over 3.5 million members… and we’re growing
  • We grew 100% by word-of-mouth
  • We are a top 800 website in most English speaking countries
  • We serve over a billion requests a month

How to apply

Send an email to jointheteam@fetlife.com. In the email, please include:

  • Tell us about three of the largest websites you’ve worked on, and for each, please describe what you were responsible for
  • A description of the types of projects and/or types of problems you would want to work on
  • Links to your GitHub and LinkedIn profiles
  • Why you think you are the best person for the job

If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to email us at jointheteam@fetlife.com!

To apply: Email jointheteam@fetlife.com with the above info.

item.title: Diagnotes: Lead Rails Developer
item.description:
Location: Indianapolis, IN
URL: http://www.diagnotes.com

Diagnotes is a HIPAA-compliant mobile communication system that helps medical groups improve communication among providers, patients and staff. Our product includes web, android and iOS applications, along with external-facing APIs and integrated 3rd party components.

Read more about us at http://www.diagnotes.com

Job Description
Work alongside our CTO as tech hire #1 to extend and improve our core Ruby on Rails application and associated APIs. Take ownership of our platform and development. Some typical tasks are:
  • extend one of our APIs to support a new 3rd party Electronic Medical Records system
  • rebuild our web front-end to use the same API as our mobile applications
  • refactor our existing encryption code into a reusable gem

You can work from our offices, or the other side of the world, as long as you can communicate effectively and handle responsibility. Our ideal candidate can:
  • Manage your own time. You get stuff done, that's the bottom line.
  • Continually improve the quality of the code you touch. You like to write missing tests (we use RSpec) and clean up ugly methods. 
  • Handle a complex development environment. You are a ninja with server logs, firebug, 3rd party tools and know where to look first.

Qualifications
Enough experience to write production-quality, we-deploy-in-flight code, and to refactor and improve existing code, on our technology stack of Rails 4 / Haml / JQuery / PostgreSQL / RESTful APIs + multiple AWS and other 3rd party components.

Extra credit if you are familiar with one or more of:
  • StrongSwan / VPN management / AWS VPC
  • Voxeo CallXML
  • AWS OpsWorks and Chef
  • AWS SNS / APNS / Google Cloud Push
  • Asymmetric cryptography / ruby-openssl
  • iOS or Android development

Additional Information
Time: from 20 hours / week (half-time) to 40 hours / week (full-time).
Job Type: W-2 (job) or 1099 (contractor), but with the goal of a long-term working relationship.
Location: Wherever is good for us, as long as you have a good internet connection. Be available periodically to plan and brainstorm.
Pay: Competitive compensation, either hourly or salary, based on your experience, availability, and enthusiasm.

No recruiters please. We do not work with, respond to, or pay recruiters, so please don't waste our time or yours.

To apply: Send a resume, github account name, and name of a favorite but not-so-common gem to work@diagnotes.com
